citation.article-title: Planomicrobium koreense gen. nov., sp. nov., a bacterium isolated from the Korean traditional fermented seafood jeotgal, and transfer of Planococcus okeanokoites (Nakagawa et al. 1996) and Planococcus mcmeekinii (Junge et al. 1998) to the genus Planomicrobium.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Planomicrobium (Pla.no.mi.cro'bi.um. Gr. n. planos wanderer; Gr. adj. micros small; Gr. n. bios life ; M.L. n. Planomicrobium motile microbe)
Cells are rods or rods to cocci}short rods.
Motile by means of a single polar flagellum or peritrichous flagella.
Colour of colonies is yellow to orange or pale orange.
Nitrate is or is not reduced to nitrite.
Hydrolysis of aesculin is negative or positive.
Hydrolyses of casein and gelatin are positive.
Hydrolyses of starch and Tween 80 are negative.
The menaquinone profile is characterized by the predominance of MK-8 followed by MK-7, or by the predominance of MK-8 followed by MK-7 and MK-6.
The cellular fatty acids are mainly saturated, unsaturated and branched fatty acids.
The GÂ­C content of the genomic DNA is 35-47 mol%.
The type species is Planomicrobium koreense.
